Actin in Hirano bodies Actin was discovered to be a component of Hirano bodies about 20 years after their discovery ( Goldman , 1983 ; Galloway et al , 1987a ) .The nature of the actin in Hirano bodies is generally supposed to be filamentous , perhaps explaining the filaments seen in regular arrays within the bodies , as Hirano bodies stain with phalloidin ( a specific stain for F - actin ) ( Galloway et al , 1987a ) .
